Questions.QuestionString: For PW 1130 Engine, When slats are extended, can you fully open reverser cowls?
Answers: No, you must not open the reverser cowl when the slats are extended

Questions.QuestionString: Where is HCU Inhibit Lever located in?
How many Hold Open Rod on each Reverser half?
How many blocker doors on each reverser half?
How many latches are used to fully close reversers?
How many locking actuators installed in 1 engine?
How many locking feedback actuators installed in 1 engine?
Two Translating sleeves of engine are synchronized by:
Answers: They are not synchronized at all

Questions.QuestionString: The Tertiary Lock system is controlled by:
For maintenance, the reversers can be deployed and stowed manually on the ground by:
Answers: Using the Manual Drive Units (MDU) located on the lower actuators
Using the Manual Drive Units (MDU) located on the upper actuators

Questions.QuestionString: Deactivation of the Hydraulic Control Unit (HCU) is provided by:
Answers: An inhibit lever and inhibit pin
An inhibit handle to provide to lock out the DCV (Directional Control Valve)

Questions.QuestionString: Two Translating sleeves of engine are synchronized by:
Answers: They are not synchronized at all

Questions.QuestionString: For de-activation thrust reverser Hydraulic Control Unit (HCU), we need to
Answers: Open the oil tank access-door on the left fan cowl-door, or if necessary, open the fan cowl doors
Open the RH fan cowl door

Questions.QuestionString: Track Lock Valve (TLV) solenoids are controlled independently by SEC.
